job_title: Nurse in Centre Hall, PA
pros: Patient centered care. Staff work hard to help patient overcome the stigma of mental health. Care is evidence based. Non-punitive environment for patients. Competitive pay and benefits. Great co-workers.
cons: Paper charting. Work can be challenging at times due to patient complexity.

job_title: Mental Health Technician in Centre Hall, PA
pros: If your good at inpatient psychiatric care, you will love the experience. Some good coworkers you will work alongside.
cons: Very short staffed, Staff to patient ratios are unsafe, patients are very aggressive and in my opinion not properly treated. Leadership is very unprofessional and undeveloped. Nurse managers are not very resourceful or capable of getting to know their staff to form better working rapports. Constant staffing request for extra shifts on your days off. Human resources seem to be incompetent, when it comes to hiring processes and often deemed very retaliatory in their termination processes. Overall this place lacks the professionalism to maintain a good working environment to retain quality staff. Very high turnover rate. The average new hire last 3-6 months.

review_title: Don’t Work Here (Unless you want to potentially  lose your license)
job_title: Registered Nurse in Centre Hall, PA
pros: Very supportive coworkers (minus management)
cons:
Management is awful, only care about money and filling beds, not patient nor staff safety or wellbeing. Management is corrupt & will retaliate against you if you speak out against something that they are doing. Awfully staffed and can’t keep anyone dt how bad they treat their employees. Often times running out of staffing ratio compliance & accept inappropriate patients that are highly dangerous, liable and violent. Your skills and values aren’t appreciated and if management doesn’t like you they will find whatever excuse to fire you, legal or not. 
Honestly don’t work here unless you want to potentially lose your license, patients and staff are placed into very sketchy situations I’ve seen people escape, get severely injured and even raped at this facility and management just looks the other way.

job_title: Behavioral Health Technician in Princeton, TX
pros: Got to work with other cool people
cons: Terrible management and bad pay

job_title: Utilization Management in Centre Hall, PA
pros: Free food sometimes and the department head of UM/UR is kind. Other than that, there aren’t many pros.
cons: Poor work environment. Staff can be toxic. Not a diverse work place. Pay is terrible.

review_title: Ok work environment, great learning experience
job_title: Mental Health Technician in Harleysville, PA
pros: Variety of ages and diagnoses to give you plenty of experience
cons: "Always staffed to state regulation"= understaffed with high acuity levels

job_title: Registered Nurse in Centre Hall, PA
pros: Co Workers are awesome people and care about the patients.
cons: Administration has no common sense, makes poor decisions poor communication with staff. Does not care about staff. Admits dangerous individuals. No security but yourselves. Over works staff. If you call off sick, they call several times a day....can't rest. Threaten write ups when it's un-warranted.

job_title: Food Service Director in Centre Hall, PA
pros: Good benefits and helpful staff.
cons: A lot of staff turnover

job_title: Mental Health Technician in State College, PA
pros: Some good and caring people work here.
cons: The company itself doesn't seem to care about its patients or staff

job_title: Behavioral Health Utilization Manager in Centre Hall, PA
pros: Coworkers and some managers are understanding and easy to work with
cons: Upper management tries but its often misplaced energy

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in State College, PA
pros: Coworkers are friendly and it is a good way to get patient care hours for students.
cons: It is not very safe for technicians, you will be put in situations of physical conflict and interactions with patients almost on a daily basis.

job_title: Mental Health Technician in Mill Hall, PA
pros: rewarding work environment, pay is okay
cons: very challenging, sometimes dangerous or unsafe

job_title: Lead MHT in Centre Hall, PA
pros: The only positive is that they are trying.
cons: Suggestions are taken lightly and no action is taken until they are in trouble

review_title: Ok if you are starting out, but don’t expect to stay long.
job_title: in Centre Hall, PA
pros: Honestly, I want to skip this question. I can’t think of much. Okay job if you are just starting out, they give you a chance that most other places won’t, but it’s because they are desperate for warm bodies, not quality employees. And they drive out the good employees.
cons: Very poor environment, extremely high turnover, no support from management, everyone is only looking out for themselves.  It’s not even worth listing it all here, if you’ve heard horror stories, they are probably true. Ok if you are starting out, but don’t expect to stay long.  The turnover is very high and there is never a backup plan, other than closing down units.  But this is only after over-stretching and over-stressing out the employees at the patient’s expense.

review_title: If you are desperate for a entry psych position but prepared to have no life go for it!
job_title: Mental Health Technician in Centre Hall, PA
pros: Awesome one on one psych experience
cons: Wow, where do I start. You will never get time off, onless you are dieing and even then you better provide a death certificate. You never know when you will get to go home, they mandate all the time. It is really unsafe with its restraint policies. If census gets too low, you get sent home(doesn't happen when you want it too) The ratio of patients to staff can be quite unsafe.

review_title: I just started several days ago - So far so good!
job_title: MHT
pros: Week long orientation, very positive interactions with fellow co workers, always willing to help.
cons: It is what you make of it, if you go into work thinking today is going to suck, then it will.  Piece of free advice... if you decided to be nasty with an attitude expect the same treatment in return.  Understand EVERY place has its downside, again, as stated above, find a way to make it positive.

review_title:
Look elsewhere!
The turnover is massive.
job_title: Professional in Bellefonte, PA
pros:
Good salary and easy to get employed. The hospital and outpatient facilities are attractive.
The benefits such as medical insurance are good.
cons:
You will do the work of two and three people.  There is little respect for employees.
You will be moved around as management sees fit. There needs to be changes in middle management who show little respect for those under them.  You will always fear losing your job.  After your income reaches a certain level, you will be in treated poorly, so that you will quit.  I would never recommend anyone working there.

job_title: Mental Health Technician II in Centre Hall, PA
pros: If you enjoy the fields of psychology, counseling, social work, or nursing this place has the experience to give. But at this place I considered my 2 years there just "doing my time" til I could find a better job.
cons:
Staffing tries to make you work double shifts all of the time due to people calling off, quitting etc. Turn over rate is high because they work you like a dog and don't pay very well.

Poor management, superiors are arrogant, rude, not helpful - had 2 higher ups quit one day and they called on the Meadows for sanitation issues, safety issues, etc.

review_title: Managment Does Not Care About Employees
job_title: Mental Health Technician in Centre Hall, PA
pros: The relationships you form with patients and feeling like you make a difference in peoples lives is rewarding. Also you form great relationships with fellow Techs.
cons: The pay is not close to what it should be for what you deal with on a daily basis. You get plenty of PTO and great benefits but can never use it because you need to request it months ahead of time to get it approved. Management treats you like a number not as an employee.

job_title: Mental Health Technician in Centre Hall, PA
pros: Lots of hours available, chance to receive inpatient mental health experience, decent benefits, every other weekend off, that's pretty much it.
cons: High turnover. Management is terrible. Staffing ratio is a joke. Understaffed but yet they try to keep the hospital running at maximum occupancy 24/7. You don't get paid enough for what you have to put up with. You get forced to stay cause people don't show up. You have to restrain patients which sometimes causes you injury. Management will find any excuse to fire you. Overall, this place will overwork you til you burn yourself out and then fire you for something stupid once you stop doing tons of overtime for them. Working here is terrible and you get paid nothing close to equal the amount of work you will put in.

job_title: Mobile Crisis Counselor in Pottsville, PA
pros: Team-oriented, extremely supportive managemen & co-workerst.  Lots of trainings and staff meetings, as well as easy shift coverage so you don't burn out.  Coordinator tends to micro-manage, but in a supportive and motivational way!! Amazing amount of constructive criticism & positive reinforcement. Best job I ever had! Provides laptop, cell phone, and scanner for each employee & nice mileage reimubursement.  Employee of the month awards are given as well for specific case handlings.
cons: Sporadac work loads, but that's mental health for ya.

review_title: More care towards bottom line than patient care.
job_title: Mental Health Technician in Centre Hall, PA
pros: Meet some awesome coworkers. Can make a difference in patient's lives.
cons: Management cares only about the bottom line. If something needs to change, staff must tell the patients to say something about it.

job_title: MHT in Centre Hall, PA
pros: Once, the coworkers were amazing and made a great team... Not much of that element is left anymore.
cons:
Management: This is the big one. There are far too many people in management who essentially do nothing, and they are all "in charge", but only maybe 1 or 2 of them know what they're talking about at any given time, if you're lucky. The 7-8 who don't really know what to do are still giving you conflicting orders, and you have to try to balance all of those if you don't want to get in trouble or fired. Most of their management team is hateful, condescending, and downright aggressive towards the staff, and not a single one of them who are still working there care about the patients or anything outside of themselves.

Dangerous. The whole facility is unclean and unsafe, they have basically no criteria for accepting a patient, and I've seen multiple occasions where small, frail staff were placed on a unit with murderers and very violent patients with no means to protect themselves. The MHT's are the only security this place has, armed with 8 hours of training in restraint and control. People get hurt weekly. 

The pay is okay, now, but their payroll department will inevitably short you multiple times, and you have to jump through hoops to get it corrected. With the moron who currently manages the Adolescent Units, you probably won't get it corrected at all, and just won't get paid.

Long hours. You're often poked, prodded and texted repeatedly to work extra shifts, and they don't care about how that may affect you. I used to do 3-4 16 hour shifts in a week, plus the rest of the days in 8 hour shifts, and still have them tell me I needed to do more.

job_title: Mental Health Technician in Centre Hall, PA
pros: Your coworkers will be the best people you meet.
cons: Management doesn't care about you. I honestly do not know where to start with the horror stories. I've been kicked off units because of techs who didnt like me and lied to the UNM. if its snowing outside and you're stuck in a ditch, dont bother to call off if its within 4 hours before you clock in, you still have to go. Half of them dont care about the patients and will discharge them before they get the proper treatment. Mandatory meetings are a joke, they tell you what you're doing wrong in front of everyone and make up a bizarre idea to fix the problem. Supervisors make the schedule 4 months in advance and give you a date to request time off (and you have a doctor's  appointment scheduled after the said date 3 months before the new schedule and give them a month in advance) they tell you you're SOL because it was after the time off request date. If you show any compassion towards a patient, they'll put you through their "handle with care" training again (which is also a joke because you'll still get hurt regardless of the "training"). The restraint training they give you hurts the patients and yourself because it's in a supine position and the patient has all their strength. Just dont do it.

job_title: Director of Plant Operations in Bellefonte, PA
pros: Staff really does have care and compassion for the patients.
cons: Administration is a joke, CEO is new and feels bullying and making impossible demands with retaliation is the way to operate.  HR sides with administration 100%, do not go to them with issues that you have.

review_title: the worst place i have ever worked.there is no respect for the employees.you are treated as an object and then discarded
job_title: Crisis Counselor in Centre Hall, PA
pros: good place to get entry level mh experience;co-workers will generally be a good bunch;provides a chance to help the patients.
cons: management does not care about their employees;they will schedule mandatory meetings;you will only find out that they have been cancelled when you show up.there is no respect for the employees time.

job_title: MHT in Centre Hall, PA
pros: Overtime is available. If you have strong communication and deescalation skills job becomes very easy.
cons: It's what you'd expect for the low salary.

job_title: Mental Health Technician in Centre Hall, PA
pros: Experience, close to Penn State
cons: Low pay, Long hours, High turnover

job_title: Mental Health Technician II in Reedsville, PA
pros: Good wages and reasonable benefits.
cons: Crazy schedules, lack of support.

job_title: MHT in Centre Hall, PA
pros: Excellent positive environment with opportunity to advance.
cons: Miscommunication at times & a very high turn over rate.
